{
  "Allegations" : "COMPLAINT ALLEGES DAVIDSON WAS NEGLIGENT BY ALLOWING CUSTOMER TO TRADE, ON AN UNSOLICITED BASIS, LEVERAGED AND INVERSE ETF'S AND OTHER HIGH RISK SECURITIES WHICH CUSTOMER ALLEGES WERE UNSUITABLE.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$800,000.00",

  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",

  "Broker Comment" : "WITHOUT ADMISSION OF LIABILITY ON THE PART OF THE REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE OR THE FIRM, D. A. DAVISON CHOSE TO SETTLE THIS MATTER. IN ADDITION, THE REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE WAS NOT SPECIFICALLY NAMED AS A DEFENDANT IN THE CIVIL LITIGATION."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "BEGINNING IN OCTOBER 2001, THE [CUSTOMERS] HAVE FILED REPEATED COMPLAINTS WITH THE FIRM AND VARIOUS REGULATORS, CHANGING ALLEGATIONS EACH TIME.  ON 2/24/03, CLIENTS SUBMITTED SPECIFIC DAMAGE CLAIMS AND ALLEGE ACTIVITY WAS UNSUITABLE.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$64,055.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$9,999.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE FINAL REGULATORY FILING THE CUSTOMER MADE WAS TO THE STATE OF NORTH DAKOTA SECURITIES DIVISION. BOTH DAVIDSON AND THE STATE CHOSE TO CLOSE THE FILE IN MAY 2003, HOWEVER THE CUSTOMER CONTINUED TO PURSUE THE MATTER. ALTHOUGH NO SALES MISCONDUCT WAS DETERMINED BY THE FIRM, THE FIRM MADE A BUSINESS DECISION TO SETTLE THIS MATTER WITH THE CUSTOMER IN SEPTEMBER 2004. "
